Key Match Events: The Padres took an early lead in the second inning and held it throughout the game.
The Braves consistently got men on base and scored every few innings, making the game an extremely close victory for the Padres.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the Padres second postseason series victory against the Braves, with the other coming in the 1998 NLCS.
The Padres will play the Los Angeles Dodgers for the third time in the NLDS, in such a series the two teams have a perfect 1-1 ratio against each other.
Others: The Braves entered the game having played Game Two of a postseason series 43 times in franchise history. They were 32-11.
Bryan Hoeing picked up the win for the Padres, with Max Fried taking the loss. Robert Suarez notched the save.
